title: Ransomware Source Codes [closed]
content: Have been searching ransomware source codes for analysis(as much as possible). I have already checked with sites like Any.Run but most of their samples are .exe and binary files. Does any one have any leads to a place I can get the source codes especially for ransomware?

comments.text: Iâ€™m voting to close this question because we're not a VX site.

In addition to Peter's remark there is nothing that has to do with reverse engineering in this question. It's more along the lines of software development, even though you claim it's just for analysis.

answers_data.content:
Here are some links you may find helpful:

You can also look for MSIL binaries, deobfuscate using de4dot and decompile using dnSpy. If sample is not strongly protected, you will get output as readable as the source code.

Nobody is going to publish their source code for active ransomware, there are various reasons for that:

A few years ago I saw a sample ransomware on GitHub, maybe that is a good starting point.
